results.title: Repurposing metformin, simvastatin and digoxin as a combination for targeted therapy for pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
results.text_hl: Repurposing @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Digoxin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004077 @@@digoxin@@@ as a combination for targeted therapy for @<m>DISEASE_Carcinoma_Pancreatic_Ductal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D021441 @@@pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma@@@.

results.title: Low dosage combination treatment with metformin and simvastatin inhibits obesity-promoted pancreatic cancer development in male KrasG12D mice
results.text_hl: Here, four-week-old @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ expressing KrasG12D in all pancreatic lineages (KC @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@) and fed an obesogenic high fat, high calorie diet that promotes early @<m>DISEASE_Carcinoma_Pancreatic_Ductal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D021441 @@@PDAC@@@ development were randomized onto low dosage @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, or both drugs in combination administered orally.

citations.NLM: Teper Y, Ye L, Waldron RT, Lugea A, Sun X, Sinnett-Smith J, Hines OJ, Pandol SJ, Rozengurt E, Eibl G. Low dosage combination treatment with metformin and simvastatin inhibits obesity-promoted pancreatic cancer development in male KrasG12D mice Sci Rep. 2023 Sep 26;13(1):16144. PMID: 37752238
